descript.abstract:
Canada Airports is a polygon theme representing airport boundaries and runways within Canada.
This data set provides six levels of generalization for displaying the data at different scales. Everything about the levels is the same but the level of generalization and its name. The least generalized level is called <data set name>. The next more generalized level is called <data set name>_1, and so on. For best performance, use the most appropriate generalized level when displaying or printing.
descript.purpose: Provides the boundaries for thousands of airports and runways.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data at the least generalized level: <data set name>: 1:100,000.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contact/.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials. This data set provides six levels of generalization.

horizpa.horizpar: The horizontal positional accuracy is 167 feet for the least generalized level. The least generalized level has the highest horizontal positional accuracy.

citeinfo.title: Tele Atlas StreetMap Premium for ArcGIS v. 9.0

serinfo.sername: Tele Atlas StreetMap Premium for ArcGIS

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted the data set from Tele Atlas StreetMap Premium for ArcGIS v. 9.0. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.
EDS staff clipped out the Canadian features and exported the result to the Shapefile format

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent the airport boundaries and runways within the United States and Canada.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The Feature Classification Code of the airport/runway.
The three- or four-character international identifier of the airport/runway.
